flounder.logger

Class FlounderLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • flounder.logger.FlounderLogger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IModule

    public class FlounderLogger
extends java.lang.Object
implements IModule
    Various utility functions for debugging.

      • log

        public <T> void log(T value)
        Log logs strings sent into a .log file, and if LOG_TO_CONSOLE is enabled it will also be logged to the IDE's console.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The object type to be logged.
        Parameters:
        value - Text or numbers being added to the log file and possibly to the IDES console.

      • log

        public <T> void log(T value,
                    boolean loud)
        Log logs strings sent into a .log file, and if LOG_TO_CONSOLE is enabled it will also be logged to the IDE's console.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The object type to be logged.
        Parameters:
        value - Text or numbers being added to the log file and possibly to the IDES console.
        loud - If the logged value is not useful, it may or may not be logged because of this.

      • error

        public <T> void error(T value)
        Error logs strings sent into javas console, and if LOG_TO_FILE is enabled it will also be logged to a log file.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The object type to be logged.
        Parameters:
        value - Errors being added to the log file and possibly to your IDES console.

      • error

        public <T> void error(T value,
                      boolean loud)
        Error logs strings sent into javas console, and if LOG_TO_FILE is enabled it will also be logged to a log file.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The object type to be logged.
        Parameters:
        value - Errors being added to the log file and possibly to your IDES console.
        loud - If the logged value is not useful, it may or may not be logged because of this.

      • exception

        public void exception(java.lang.Exception exception)
        Exception logs strings sent into javas console, and if LOG_TO_FILE is enabled it will also be logged to a log file.
        Parameters:
        exception - The exception added to the log file and possibly to your IDES console.

      • getDateString

        public java.lang.String getDateString()
        Returns:
        Returns the string of the current date as [hour:minute:second | day/month/year].
